p.b: All Lamoni Community Schools are closed for the remainder of the academic year.

div.p: Governor Kim Reynolds has mandated that all Iowa school buildings will be closed for the remainder of 2019/2020 academic year. In accordance with that, Lamoni Community School District will no longer hold classes in the building, but there are multiple opportunities provided online and in the form of packets produced by Lamoni District teachers and meals will continue to be served as they have been.
The Latest updates can be found here

span.span: Â Â Â Lamoni Community Schools will light up the baseball and softball fields Friday, April 24 starting at 8 pm. The lights will remain on for 1 minute for each day our school district has been out of school for the COVID-19 shutdown. This will give our community and our students a chance to show support for one another. We are lighting up these fields in hopes that we are back as a school and community supporting our Lamoni Demon baseball and softball teams in competition. As always we need to be very mindful of the situation. Supporters are welcome to drive through north park and show their support in any positive way they want to, but we will not be stopping at the parks and gathering. I have been so impressed to watch Lamoni citizens support each other in so many ways. I am proud to be a part of the school and community! Below is the statement from the IHSADA.

Â Â Â Â The Iowa High School Athletic Directors Association (IHSADA) would like to invite you to participate in a voluntary program as we seek to âLight Up Iowaâ by lighting up our stadiums at 8:00 pm each Friday night. At 8:00 weekly on Friday night we ask that we all join together and turn on the lights of our stadiums and leave them on for one minute for each day we have been out of school. We would encourage you to use the hashtag âlightupIAâ and also include @ihsada in each of your social media posts that you use to promote on your Twitter feed. This is obviously a voluntary activity to be determined by your district but is an opportunity to light up the night and let our communities and students know that we miss them and look forward to having them back in our stadiums with the lights on and our communities back together.

div.p:
Lamoni Demons Community,
Â Â Â In her news conference today, Governor Reynolds announced that Iowa schools will not reopen for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to the spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19).Â I want to be clear though, that while the Governorâs directive does not reopen schools, we are NOT done educating our students.Â
Â Â Â The Iowa Girls High . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about April 17 COVID-19 Community Memo

div.p:
Lamoni Community,Â
Â
Â Â Â As we reflect on the last 19 school days students have missed due to Governor Reynoldsâs emergency declaration, we are acutely aware that we have had to respond to challenges none of us have ever experienced - as individuals, in our families or in our school community.Â Despite our current circumstances, I am inspired by the efforts of our staff to make the best of . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lamoni COVID-19 Parent Memo, April 10

div.p:
Lamoni School Community,
Â
Â Â Â Yesterday afternoon Governor Reynolds ordered a two week extension to the current school closure, moving the date from April 10 to April 30, which aligns with current Federal guidance.Â Please note she has also formally shifted from a recommendation to an order for school closure. The link to the Governor's order follows: Governor's Release 4-2-20 . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Community Memo 4/3/20

h3.a: Lamoni Community Schools Parent COVID-19 Parent Memo 3/27/2020

div.p:
March 27, 2020
Â
Lamoni School Community,Â Â
Â
Â Â Â Â Since there has been no change in the Governor Reynoldâs recommendation for schools to remain closed through April 10 and after consultation with Lamoni Board Directors, Lamoni Community Schools will remain closed through at least Friday, April 3, 2020.Â Â
Â . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lamoni Community Schools Parent COVID-19 Parent Memo 3/27/2020

div.p:
Â
Dear Parent / Guardian;
Â
Â Â Â Â As we find ourselves in the mix of uncertainty during this time, we want to reassure you that the Lamoni Community School District is working hard to help lighten the load that you as a parent / guardian have now found yourself potentially in.Â We have met as various stakeholders in the district to determine how we can help meet the needs of everyone we serve . . .

div.p:
Congratulations to the Lamoni FFA members that represented us today at the South Central District Convention.
Results:Â
Chapter Website- silver, Team- Cameron Martin, Javin Evans, Brooke Salmi, Ashleigh Gerke, Audrey Lloyd, Matthew Burton
Chapter Scrapbook- participation, Chloe Boyce, Brenna Pierce
And.......we are going to state in FFA Creed Speaking- gold, Heiatua Paredes!!!!!

Read more about Preschool Round-Up Postponed

h3.a: Lamoni FFA attends Sub-District Career Development Events at Creston

div.p:
Lamoni FFA members attended the Sub-District Leadership Development Events (LDEs)
held at Creston High School on Wednesday Feb. 19th . The Spring FFA LDEs focus on leadership, communication, teamwork and confidence. Leadership Development Events include: Ag. Sales, Ag. Broadcasting, Parliamentary Procedure, Conduct of Meetings, Public Speaking, Extemporaneous Speaking, Job Interview, Chapter Program, FFA Greenhand Knowledge . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lamoni FFA attends Sub-District Career Development Events at Creston

div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 06:53 am CDT

td.span: A chance of showers, then showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm after 1pm. Cloudy, with a high near 66. Light and variable wind becoming southeast 5 to 9 mph in the morning. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Showers likely, mainly before 11pm. Cloudy, with a low around 47. North wind around 11 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New precipitation amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 64. North wind 11 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
